snippet: Financial planners and lawyers have helped well-off retirees qualify for benefits by transferring or hiding assets, the Government Accountability Office has found.
abstract: Government Accountability Office reports that weak oversight and unclear rules have made the federal pension program for low-income veterans ripe for abuse by financial planners and lawyers who help well-off retirees qualify for benefits by transferring or hiding assets; finds that more than 200 firms have sprouted up across the country to help veterans restructure assets so they can appear indigent and therefore eligible for tax-free pensions, which can pay more than $20,000 a year.
lead_paragraph: Financial planners and lawyers have helped well-off retirees qualify for benefits by transferring or hiding assets, the Government Accountability Office has found.

headline.main: Veterans Pension Program Is Being Abused, Report Says
